title: King of clubs animation changes, but no queen of diamonds update?

embed.description: This is a WORK IN PROGRESS POST - check back for constant updates now that today's patch out. The PBE currently still down for maintenance.] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers!

body: So first off, I adore all of the new card skins, and I am ecstatic that morde's is getting unique animations. However I am very surprised that if morde is receiving updated animations, Queen if diamonds syndra is not, especially given the community backlash. Could we get a rioter to discuss this with us?

replies.body:
Hey!

As DreamLeviathan has touched on, some lower tier skins will receive particle changes if their current particles don't do justice to the skin. These are more so "quality of life" particle changes. Taking Warden Nautilus for example, if he had his deep sea grates floating around him instead of the shields present in the skin , it might read really bad or come off a strange. The particle changes for King of Clubs Mordekaiser is so that his Q better matches his weapon.

Hope this helps!
This is actually a model, which is why it falls into the category of being changed, rather than a quality of life particle. :]

But Syndra's spheres are also part of her model. They follow her around her the entire game and stay on the map for several seconds when cast, acting as an object.

Also, for Mordekaiser, please change the head that spins around over the marked target with his ult to match his new model's head. And these changes should also be applied for Lord Mordekaiser.

Ahri's orb is also with her the entire game, but that's something that even if we could change (game play clarity is why it doesn't change color based on skin), we wouldn't change for a 750 RP skin. 

His ult indicator is also a particle, which is why we don't have plans to change it.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=IYkmPzEn,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-03T17:26:58.200+0000)
>
> Ahri's orb is also with her the entire game, but that's something that even if we could change (game play clarity is why it doesn't change color based on skin), we wouldn't change for a 750 RP skin. 

You could try changing the shape of Syndra's particles instead of the color, as I've already suggested in at least one other thread. As long as they're roughly the same color (you or some other Riot have already mentioned that you *can* change the hue, but not the color itself because the skin would require the color to be red) and size, Syndra's particles are easily read as "danger: Syndra's going to hit you with that." If Atlantean and Justicar Syndra could make it past your "clarity control" requirements, I don't see how this small enhancement (diamond-shaped "orb" particles) is so difficult for Riot to adopt and add. It's definitely a "quality-of-life" particle for the skin, but I guess Riot's skin standards for pricing/tiers were made flexible so that cases like this could be ignored or denied at will.

Changing the hue rather than the color was in reference to Ahri's orb for 975 RP+ skins. For example, the hue is shifted to Popstar Ahri. 

750 RP skins don't receive recolored/color shifted particles, and in the cases of a quality of life particles, this is usually in the case of a champion receiving a new weapon, and matching their skills to their new weapon. For example, Warden Sivir, or Wild Card Shaco.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=IYkmPzEn,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-03T17:44:05.659+0000)

> Changing the hue rather than the color was in reference to Ahri's orb for 975 RP+ skins. For example, the hue is shifted to Popstar Ahri. 
> 
> 750 RP skins don't receive recolored/color shifted particles, and in the cases of a quality of life particles, this is usually in the case of a champion receiving a new weapon, and matching their skills to their new weapon. For example, Warden Sivir, or Wild Card Shaco.

Syndra's orbs *are* her weapons, Katey. They're easily discerned as her main armament, being usable with all of her skills to harm or hamper her opponents.

Edit: Wouldn't using weapons as the main precedent for 750 RP quality-of-life particles make for a bad precedent/guideline? That restricts which champions can receive a decent 750 RP skinâ€” champions that don't throw physical weapons around as part of their abilities could get stuck with sub-par 750 RP skins (like Queen of Hearts Syndra appears destined to be released as) due to their having extremely unfitting base ability particles. I'm not saying that every 750 RP skin needs new particles (I think that Marauder Warwick and Ace of Spades Ezreal look fine as they are, personally), but claiming that quality-of-life particle changes must involve a champion's physical weapons could indeed cripple 750 RP skins as a whole. Plus, Warden Nautilus' particle changes don't involve his weapon (an anchor), they're a floating set of shields that only appear when he's using his W (which definitely appears to have magical origins in addition to not involving his anchor). Syndra's orbs are far closer to being her "weapons" (being always present on the battlefield and/or around her model) than Nautilus' W particles.

But if her weapons are purple at every moment,then there is no need to changes.
They changed Sivir's Q because to would look weird to be holding one weapon,then it change to the weapon of her base skin once she threw it.

> [{quoted}](name=Jeddy017,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=IYkmPzEn,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-03T17:57:21.061+0000)
>
> But if her weapons are purple at every moment,then there is no need to changes.
> They changed Sivir's Q because to would look weird to be holding one weapon,then it change to the weapon of her base skin once she threw it.

That's why I mentioned changing the basic shape (but not the color or size) of Queen of Diamonds Syndra's orbs. It "looks weird" for a skin that's based around red diamonds to be throwing around purple orbs. We can't give her red particles because that would cause a clarity issue for mirror matches (opposing Syndras in mirror matches see their opposite's orbs as red-colored), but making the orbs into diamonds (albeit somewhat "fat" diamonds in order to ensure that they remain roughly the same size as her original orbs) could be classified as a quality-of-life change without sacrificing clarity.

Another possibility would be simply having small red diamond particles floating inside of the original purple orbs. An enemy Syndra would still have red orbs; an allied Syndra would still have purple orbs (but her orbs would simply have a thematically-fitting, unobtrusive, quality-of-life particle).

Dude,it's a 750 tier & 750 tier skins are simple costume changes.Doing all that is outside the scope they had planned.
It's clear Riot isn't planning on changing this.If they do,it would be a middle finger to the Annie & Ashe players who asked for similar changes,but got nothing.Why should Syndra players get this when Annie & Ashe players got nothing?

>Should have,could have,would have,the fact is they weren't.The fact is Riot choose their limits & choose to make these skins within those limits.
Cheaper things will have less.

750 tier skins are eligible for quality-of-life particles. Adding said particles is within the scope of a 750 tier skin.
In case you haven't noticed, there are already several 750 RP skins that have more than simple costume changes (Warden Nautilus, Warden Sivir, Wild Card Shaco, King of Clubs Mordekaiser). Players of the champions that received those skins got new particles while Annie and Ashe players got nothing.

>Should have,could have,would have,the fact is they weren't.The fact is Riot choose their limits & choose to make these skins within those limits.

Riot has chosen to ignore those limits multiple times; in fact, they have expanded those limits in order to allow for quality-of-life particles. Queen of Diamonds Syndra is perfectly eligible and deserving of such a change, but Riot has singled her out among the new card-themed skins to be inferior.

>Cheaper things will have less.

Obviously, but Queen of Diamonds Syndra could afford to have more while still remaining within the cheapest current skin tier, as evidenced by the 750 tier skins that have particle changes.
I think the argument here is that those skins should've been changed too, or at least Riot should have had the foresight to think about those things before releasing the skins.

Should have,could have,would have,the fact is they weren't.The fact is Riot choose their limits & choose to make these skins within those limits.
Cheaper things will have less.
